intro: Matricaria africana, commonly known as African chamomile, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, feathery leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer months and are used in traditional medicine for their calming and anti-inflammatory properties. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is also valued for its aromatic and therapeutic uses.
